docs.summary: The wix-media-backend module contains functionality for working with the media that is stored in your site's Media Manager.
description: To use the Private Media API, import `wixMedia` from the `wix-media-backend` module:

params.name: file
params.doc: The Media Manager name or Wix URL of the file to get the information for.

docs.summary: Gets an upload URL and a corresponding upload token.
description: The `getUploadUrl()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an object
containing an upload URL and a corresponding upload token.
Use `getUploadUrl()` to allow an external client to upload a file to your
The external client uploads a file by performing a POST operation to the
returned URL using multipart/form-data encoding and sending the following data:
The POST will return the following:

docs.summary: Imports a file to the Media Manager from a URL.
description: The `importFile()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information
When the file is imported, When the file is imported the [`onFileUploaded()`](wix-media-backend.Events.html#onFileUploaded)
Video and audio files that have been imported are not immediately available
to be used even after the Promise is resolved. Before they can be used, they
must first undergo transcoding. When the transcoding is finished,
event is fired a second time.

params.name: path
params.doc:
The path within the Media Manager where the file will be
 uploaded. If the path does not yet exist, the missing folders will be created.

params.name: fileContent
params.doc: Buffer containing the content to be uploaded.

params.name: fileName
params.doc: Name of the file to upload. This name will be used in the Media Manager.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when uploading the file.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Information about the file that was uploaded.

docs.summary: Uploads a file to the Media Manager.
description: The `upload()` function returns a Promise that resolves to information about
When the file is uploaded the [`onFileUploaded()`](wix-media-backend.Events.html#onFileUploaded)
Video and audio files that have been uploaded are not immediately available
to be used even after the Promise is resolved. Before they can be used, they
must first undergo transcoding. When the transcoding is finished,
event is fired a second time.

examples.title: Upload a file from a URL

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to upload a file using a custom upload button. It assumes you have a regular button on your page wired to an event handler. It also assumes that you have installed the **request-promise** node module to your site. The example uses **request-promise** to create a Buffer containing the contents of the file to upload.

docs.summary: An object containing information about the file that was uploaded.

examples.title: Receive an event when a file has been uploaded
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

members.name: fileName
members.doc:
File name of the file that was uploaded. This name
 is used when calling the [`getFileInfo()`](#getFileInfo), [`getFileUrl()`](#getFileUrl),
 and [`getVideoPlaybackUrl()`](#getVideoPlaybackUrl) functions.

members.name: mediaType
members.doc:
Type of the file that was uploaded.
 One of:

 + `"audio"`
 + `"document"`
 + `"image"`
 + `"shape"`
 + `"video"`

members.name: sizeInBytes
members.doc: Size of the uploaded file in bytes.

members.name: isPrivate
members.doc:
Whether the link to the uploaded file is
 public or private. Private links require a token to be used.

members.name: mimeType
members.doc: Mime type of the uploaded file.

members.name: iconUrl
members.doc: URL of the file's icon.

members.name: fileUrl
members.doc: URL of the file.

members.name: originalFileName
members.doc:
Name of the uploaded file. This is the name
 that appears in the Media Manager.

members.name: hash
members.doc: File hash.

members.name: labels
members.doc: List of labels assigned to the file by the Media Manager.

docs.summary: An object representing options to use when importing a file.

members.name: mimeType
members.doc: Mime type of the file to import. The specified value must match the actual mime type of the file's content.

members.name: mediaType
members.doc:
Type of the file to upload.
 One of:

 + `"audio"`
 + `"document"`
 + `"image"``
 + `"shape"`
 + `"video"`

members.name: isPrivate
members.doc:
Whether the link to the uploaded file will
 be public or private. Private links require a token to be used. Defaults to
 `false`.

members.name: isVisitorUpload
members.doc:
Indicates if the file was uploaded by a
 site visitor. Files uploaded by visitors are tagged in the Media Manager as
 being added by a visitor. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: context
members.doc:
An object of key:value string pairs that is sent
 back in the [`onFileUploaded()`](wix-media-backend.Events.html#onFileUploaded)
 event.

docs.summary: An object containing information about the media options of a file to upload.
